de.slothsoft.charts.linechart

Class LineChart

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.slothsoft.charts.Chart
      • de.slothsoft.charts.linechart.LineChart

  • public class LineChart
extends Chart
    This class represents a Chart that displays lines of some sort inside a coordinate system. It's structure looks like this:
    Since:
    0.1.0
    Author:
    Stef Schulz

    • Method Detail

      • paintOn

        public void paintOn(GraphicContext gc,
                    PaintInstructions instructions)
        Description copied from class: Chart
        Paints the current content onto the graphic context. Checks the instructions for what to paint. The instructions contain the area in display coordinates, starting from the top left with 0|0 and ending bottom right with something like 800|600.
        Overrides:
        paintOn in class Chart
        Parameters:
        gc - graphic context; coordinates are relative to the screen
        instructions - additional instructions like the area to paint on

      • moveDisplayedAreaByChartCoordinates

        public void moveDisplayedAreaByChartCoordinates(double xIncrement,
                                                double yIncrement)
        Moves the displayed area of this Chart by the coordinates used for the entire chart. Let's say the chart is painted on an area 1000x1000 pixels, but the graph only displays something between the coordinates 0 and 1. If you move 100pixels in the chart scale, you only need to move the graph 0.1 points.
        Parameters:
        xIncrement - the x movement
        yIncrement - the y movement
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if graph was never painted before

      • zoomDisplayedAreaInByChartCoordinates

        public void zoomDisplayedAreaInByChartCoordinates(double chartX,
                                                  double chartY)
        Zooms the graph area in using the chart's coordinates.
        Parameters:
        chartX - the x coordinate in the chart's coordinate system
        chartY - the y coordinate in the chart's coordinate system
        See Also:

      • convertToGraphCoordinates

        public double[] convertToGraphCoordinates(double chartX,
                                          double chartY)
        Converts chart coordinates to a graph ones. The chart is everything and x and y move from the top left to the bottom right. The graph is the area with the lines and moves from bottom left to top right.
        Parameters:
        chartX - the x coordinate in the chart's coordinate system
        chartY - the y coordinate in the chart's coordinate system
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if graph was never painted before
        See Also:
        convertToGraphX(double), convertToGraphY(double)

      • convertToGraphX

        public double convertToGraphX(double chartX)
        Converts a chart coordinate to a graph one. The chart is everything and x and y move from the top left to the bottom right. The graph is the area with the lines and moves from bottom left to top right.
        Parameters:
        chartX - the x coordinate in the chart's coordinate system
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if graph was never painted before
        See Also:
        convertToGraphCoordinates(double, double), convertToGraphY(double)

      • convertToGraphY

        public double convertToGraphY(double chartY)
        Converts a chart coordinate to a graph one. The chart is everything and x and y move from the top left to the bottom right. The graph is the area with the lines and moves from bottom left to top right.
        Parameters:
        chartY - the y coordinate in the chart's coordinate system
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if graph was never painted before
        See Also:
        convertToGraphCoordinates(double, double), convertToGraphX(double)

      • convertToChartX

        public double convertToChartX(double graphX)

        Parameters:

        Throws:

      • getDisplayedArea

        public Area getDisplayedArea()
        Returns the displayed area of this chart, i.e. the coordinates to display. null is used to indicate the value is calculated by questioning the Lines.
        Returns:
        the displayed area

      • displayedArea

        Returns:
        this instance

      • getZoomFactor

        public double getZoomFactor()
        Returns the factor which should be used to zoom the graph area. A value of 0.25 means it gets zoomed by 25%.
        Returns:
        the zoom factor
        See Also:
        zoomDisplayedAreaInByChartCoordinates(double, double), zoomDisplayedAreaInByGraphCoordinates(double, double), zoomDisplayedAreaOutByChartCoordinates(double, double), zoomDisplayedAreaOutByGraphCoordinates(double, double)

      • zoomFactor

        public LineChart zoomFactor(double newZoomFactor)
        Sets the factor which should be used to zoom the graph area. A value of 0.25 means it gets zoomed by 25%.
        Parameters:
        newZoomFactor - the zoom factor
        Returns:
        this instance
        See Also:
        zoomDisplayedAreaInByChartCoordinates(double, double), zoomDisplayedAreaInByGraphCoordinates(double, double), zoomDisplayedAreaOutByChartCoordinates(double, double), zoomDisplayedAreaOutByGraphCoordinates(double, double)
